Reviews.Content: This darn tablet is driving me crazy....The main problem is that it tries to type everything it hears......I mean everything.  Of course it is not typing English.  Best I can figure it is attempting to write Chinese.  You just constantly get a bunch of symbols.  It is impossible to use it much less teach someone how to use it because of that constant interruption from it typing on its own.  My computer tech has it now.........he may be able to get rid of the voice command problem but it is going to cost me........I figured out how to turn it off......but it keeps turning itself back on...........tried putting a piece of tape over the microphone............didn't help.  As far as directions / operating instructions..................horrible.................definitely a poor Chinese translation with conflicting instructions and false info.JUST WANTED THIS FOR MY MOTHER TO PLAY WORDS WITH FRIENDS WITH ME AS HER IPHONE IS TOO TINY FOR HER TO SEE....................THIS WoPad IS ........SoBad...........she can not even use it.............shoulda got her the Kindle HD.  at least Amazon has some support and can help get it running..............but hey, its a pretty pink.........paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for the Price (especially for a newbie)
Reviews.Author: Laura "Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this without having much expectations for my 4 year old daughter. It was only $70 and most tablets are hundreds. However, it came quickly, in the pink color I asked for. When I first plugged it in to charge (it says to charge first), I was concerned that it wasn't charging properly because the icon didn't show the charging symbol for more than a second or so. However, it did charge and I've downloaded several apps and have been using it. It's the perfect size (to me) because it isnt so big that it is cumbersome and it isn't so small t hat it is annoying. My only complaint is that it doesn't hold a charge for too long (about 2 hours). So as long as you remember to charge it, you are fine. I imagine my daughter will physically break it if I don't get a case for it, but that isn't zeepads fault. I sort of want one myself. OH.....I got the single camera. It has one camera on the side where the screen is. If you want to take pictures and actually see the thing you are taking pictures of, you may want to get the dual camera.

Reviews.Title: Good bang for the buck.
Reviews.Author: DonÂ Tuleja

Reviews.Content: lasted four months thats it slowly stopped charging then went to charge it and it wont turn on bought this for my daughters birthdaywhat a let down

Reviews.Title: It and miss
Reviews.Author: A. C. Pyle
Reviews.Content: I have bought 2 of these Zeepad tablets and 3 other off brand tablets since May. It seems they all either work great or not at all.  This review is specially for the Zeepads.  The first one worked so great (the best one of the 5) that within 2 weeks I bought a second one, the second one is horrible, screen is fuzzy, runs much slower than the first, most of all the wifi will not turn on at all.  When you slide wifi to "on" it automatically turns itself back to "off"  I have tried everything suggestion I can come up with:  try at McDonalds, reset router, clear cache, factory reset, the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: Nice little tablet
Reviews.Author: Chad M. "Chad"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something inexpensive for my 5 year old, he is too advanced for the normal "kid" tablets, meaning he is used to navigating android phones and other tablets.  I have only had it 2 days but so far its exactly what i need.  His last one was a bit more expensive, and even with a screen protector and a big case, he broke it.  So far this tablet is better than that one, meaning faster and able to handle movies without having to change the file type etc...and if it breaks, its 1/3 of the cost of most other tablets, plus his favorite color is red so that added to the excitement.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Zuhair Baker
Reviews.Content: For a tablet that cost about $80 it is great slow but for your kids it is what you should get them they can play watch and it has all Android stuff.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my 4 year old
Reviews.Author: Bryan "hydrophoid"
Reviews.Content: No one is going to love working on this tablet, but at the price point I hope no one is expecting to work on this tablet (you could do some work with it but you would not like it).Overall this is a great tablet for the price. My wife and I debated getting our 4 year old a LeapPad for educational games, but I was able to win out by pointing out the cost of many Android games: free.The screen has a small viewing angle and the resolution isn't the best, my daughter loves playing the ABC and puzzle games we downloaded for her. I have not purchased any software for her, but the free games on Play are awesome. This thing even runs Candy Crush (just in case you were wondering :).I wish this didn't have a proprietary charging end on it (it has a USB port, but that is not for charging) but my other tablets also have proprietary charging ports so it seems to be standard for them to make a different port.The box was full of goodies: charging cable, usb adapter (so you can plug in full sized usb items to the tablet), a stylus, AND a screen protector. They really delivered on the packaging.This tablet is really a bargain for the price, it wont win any processor speed awards and it can hang at times but if you are in the same boat and looking for something to entertain your children during long drives or you want to use some type of electronic game/learning system this is priced to be in your top 5 list of purchase considerations. On the other hand, if you are an adult looking for something to surf the web/look for jobs/ do any type of professional work with, I would suggest a different more powerful (and likely expensive) tablet.Willie-B

Reviews.Title: Great for kids

Reviews.Content: This is great for my grandson with downs syndrome. He broke the glass and they even repaired it for $20.00
